name: Rumtek Monastery
details: Rumtek Monastery is the largest monastery near Gangtok, known as the Dharma Chakra Centre with expansive prayer halls, colorful thangkas, and important Kagyu lineage artifacts

name: Pemayangtse Monastery
details: Pemayangtse Monastery near Pelling is an ancient Nyingma monastery famed for its elegant architecture, historic murals, and stunning views of Kanchenjunga

name: Enchey Monastery
details: Enchey Monastery, just outside Gangtok, dates back around two centuries and is noted for its murals, annual Cham dance festival, and hilltop views over the city

name: Lingdum Monastery
details: Lingdum Monastery is a modern, well-maintained monastery known for its peaceful grounds, study programs, and scenic Himalayan backdrop

name: Tsuk La Khang Monastery
details: Tsuk La Khang (Tsuklakhang) is the royal chapel and central temple in Gangtok, housing important statues and serving as a focal point for state religious ceremonies

name: Do Drul Chorten Monastery
details: Do Drul Chorten is a prominent stupa complex in Gangtok surrounded by mani walls and prayer wheels, visited frequently for circumambulation and blessings

name: Dubdi Monastery
details: Dubdi Monastery, one of Sikkim’s oldest, sits near Yuksom and is valued for its historic two‑story stone architecture and tranquil hilltop setting

name: Tashiding Monastery
details: Tashiding Monastery, perched on a hill between the Rathong and Rangit rivers, is a sacred site celebrated for its chortens and annual rituals that pilgrims consider purifying

name: Sanga Choeling Monastery
details: Sanga Choeling Monastery is an old hilltop monastery offering serene meditation spaces and panoramic views, reached by a steep, scenic climb above Pelling

name: Kheocheolpalri Monastery
details: Khecheopalri (Kheocheolpalri) is a sacred lakeside temple site associated with wish‑fulfilling legends and frequented by pilgrims for its spiritual ambience.

name: Karthok Monastery
details: Kartok (Karthok) Monastery is a historic monastic site known for teaching and traditional religious study in its local community

name: Phensang Monastery
details: Phensang Monastery is a regional religious center noted for community rituals and its role in local Buddhist life.

name: Phodong Monastery
details: Phodong Monastery is an important Kagyu monastery in North Sikkim, celebrated for its murals, ancient artifacts, and annual festivals

name: Labrang Monastery
details: Labrang Monastery hosts local ceremonies and serves the spiritual needs of its rural catchment, often featuring colorful ritual dances.

name: Lachen Monastery
details: Lachen is a gateway town to high‑altitude monasteries and mountain scenery, serving as the starting point for visits to nearby Buddhist sites and alpine villages

name: Lachung Monastery
details: Lachung is a mountain village that hosts small monasteries and acts as an access point for spiritual sites and high‑altitude trekking routes

name: Tolung Monastery
details: Tolung Monastery is a lesser-known hilltop monastery offering quiet prayer spaces and panoramic views of rural Sikkim.

name: Ralong Monastery
details: Ralong Monastery is known for its vibrant festivals and traditional Tibetan Buddhist ceremonies that draw local devotees and visitors

name: Bermoik Monastery
details: Bermoik is a locality with nearby temples and small monastic sites that reflect local devotional practices.

name: Dalling Monastery
details: Dalling (Doling) refers to hamlets with nearby monastic shrines and community temples serving village populations.

name: Kewzing Monastery
details: Kewzing is a small community area with nearby temples and serene rural settings often used as a base for visiting local monasteries and nature spots.

name: YangYang Monastery
details: Yang Yang area contains local temples and small monasteries that provide cultural and spiritual services to nearby villages.

name: Namchi Monastery
details: Namchi is a town with important religious landmarks and access to nearby monasteries and pilgrimage routes.

name: Rinchenpong Monastery
details: Rinchenpong is a historic town offering access to monasteries, scenic viewpoints, and cultural sites in West Sikkim.

name: Tingbung Monastery
details: Tingbung is a remote locality with nearby gompas and mountain shrines visited by regional pilgrims.

name: Burtek Amalok Monastery
details: Burtuk Amalok (Burtuk Amolok) includes small temples and local monastic presences near Gangtok’s outskirts.

name: Wok Parbong Monastery
details: Wok Parbong is a village area containing traditional shrines and community prayer spaces.

name: Mangbru Monastery
details: Mangbru is a rural locality with nearby gompas and sacred sites that serve local devotees

name: Line Phagyal Monastery
details: Line Phagyal is a small settlement with surrounding temples and monastery hamlets.

name: Malam Monastery
details: Malam is a highland village with access to remote monastic sites and alpine landscapes.

name: Tsungthang Monastery
details: Tsungthang is a village area with nearby monasteries and local religious traditions integrated into village life.
